sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you want to <radical>loiter</radical> on a <radical>cliff</radical> with the <radical>pope</radical> you better be ready to move in perfect <kanji>circulation</kanji> with him. The pope is wearing really heavy robes and it's hot up here on this cliff, so you both need to walk in circles to keep cool.
meaningInfo: Imagine this strange circulation of you and the pope up here on a cliff. It's not even like you two are up here for a reason, you're just loitering. But he doesn't want to be hot so he makes you circulate with him.
readingMnemonic: This <kanji>circulation</kanji> wouldn't have to even be happening if it wasn't <reading>June</reading> (<ja>じゅん</ja>). The cliffs are so hot in June, and in any other month the two of you would have just sat down and had a chat. But in June you have to do this weird circulation dance.
readingInfo: "This circulation is all June's fault," you mutter, walking in a circle with the pope to stay cool.
